quotes.quote: Questioning is the piety of thought.
Openly questioning the way the world works and challenging the power of the powerful is not an activity customarily rewarded.
The question is not what we intended ourselves to be, but what He intended us to be when He made us.
Certainly you will have doubts. There will be questionings and faith will return again. That is how faith is established.
The second you stop questioning yourself is the second that you become the monster.
A mind that questions everything, unless strong enough to bear the weight of its ignorance, risks questioning itself and being engulfed in doubt.
Persistent questioning and healthy inquisitiveness are the first requisite for acquiring learning of any kind.
The answers you get depend on the questions you ask.
The questioning spirit is the rebellious spirit. A rebellion is always either a cloak to hide a prince, or the swaddling wrapper of a new rule.
The first key to wisdom is assiduous and frequent questioning.
We grow up never questioning that which is unquestioned around us.
The path to holiness lies through questioning everything.
Whenever you are questioning a person's desire for something, consider what he does, not necessarily what he says.
Questioning is not the mode of conversation among gentlemen.
The very act of questioning whether you exist proves you do, because you must be there for the doubt to be entertained in the first place.
Questioning our stressful thoughts, we come to see they're not true.

The questions you ask consistently will create either enervation or enjoyment, indignation or inspiration, misery or magic. Ask the questions that will uplift your spirit and push you along the path of human excellence.
Most people ask questions because they want to know the answer; lawyers are trained never to ask questions unless they already know the answer.
Questioning growth is deemed to be the act of lunatics, idealists and revolutionaries. But question it we must.
The key to wisdom is this -- constant and frequent questioning ... for by doubting we are led to question and by questioning we arrive at the truth.
Disability doesn't make you exceptional, but questioning what you think you know about it does.
Be confident, and just do it. It's all about not questioning what everyone else is thinking, since they're probably looking to others to know what is or isn't cool.
If it's worth listening to, it's worth questioning until you understand it.
Questioning the ostensibly unquestionable premises of our way of life is arguably the most urgent of services we owe our fellow humans and ourselves.

The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existence. One cannot help but be in awe when he contemplates the mysteries of eternity, of life, of the marvelous structure of reality. It is enough if one tries merely to comprehend a little of this mystery each day.
To contact the deeper truth of who we are, we must engage in some activity or practice that questions what we assume to be true about ourselves.
Art is the questioning of culture.
You can question somebody's views and their judgment without questioning their motives or patriotism.
You really get tired in one area of your life, and then you start questioning your whole existence.
Respect authority while questioning it.
